titleStmt.title: Granville Alfred et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG0910

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p: To the Govenor of the Commonwealth of kentucky having had one of the most willfull murders Commited on the 19th day of January last in Mercer County by one George. D. McKeney upon the person of John. J. Gritton a good sittson and a loyal man and a peasible man we the under signed pray your honor to assist us in offring such a Reward as will bring the Guilty to Justice Mckiney has left for parts unknown Mckiney is twenty years old five feet nine inches high compleciton fare eyes Blue hare darke Respectifuly yours

Granville Alfred
James M Kys
P. H. Alfred
T J Driskell
Thomas Riley
W Honer
H
D Dupont
george Sutone
W. M. young
Wm Howard
J M Malls
Allen Southern

Elijah Reed
Wilson alison --

ira million
hogling Gritton

Barr

Caleb Kelly

Jeptha Ward
Burton Yorcum

mosley

J H Matheny
J. E. Paxton
Thos Edwards
Presiding Judge of Mercer County Court
They is allredy $150 " " Reward for the said McIny John Gritton
